jsx
Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.TaskManager

public final class TaskManager
extends Disposable

Facilitates multitasking features by queuing the submitted Runnable tasks and running them in the submitted order.

An instance of this class keeps a FIFO queue of Runnable objects. The task manager keeps popping a task from the head of the queue and runs it in the same thread. It falls into sleep when the queue becomes empty, taking up no CPU time and wakes up again when a new task is submitted. A call to the method submit(Runnable) on the task manager pushes the argument task to the tail of the queue in the calling thread.

This class provides a simple but efficient mechanism for multitasking needs, which is used by the Source class to implement a high level event model. Note that, the re-compiled JavaScript code is to be run in a single thread. However, in JS Simulation mode, the scenario is quite different: the tasks submitted to the same task manager are being run in the single thread, but the tasks submitted to different task managers are being run in different threads. This is because this class creates an Interval object for its periodic executions. Interval calls the Global.setInterval(js.core.JsFunction, Number) method which calls the Js.setInterval(js.core.JsFunction, Number) method which is simulating JavaScript in Java multi-thread environment and creates a new thread whenever called. The whole thing is designed deliberately for the efficiency for JS Simulation.

Note that, this class is final and not extensible.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:

Method Detail

idle

public final boolean idle()

Checks if the task manager is idle.

Returns:
true if the task manager is idle; false otherwise.
Since:
1.0

size

public final int size()

Returns the number of the pending tasks for this task manager to run.

Returns:
The size of the pending tasks to run.
Since:
1.0

poll

public final java.lang.Runnable poll()

Polls the first pending task.

If there is no pending tasks, this method returns null. If there is no pending tasks left after popping the last one, this method put the task manager into sleep before it returns the last task.

Returns:
The first pending task.
Since:
1.0

peek

public final java.lang.Runnable peek()

Peeks the last pending task.

If there is no pending tasks, this method returns null.

Returns:
The last pending task.
Since:
1.0

pop

public final java.lang.Runnable pop()

Pops the last pending task.

If there is no pending tasks, this method returns null.

Returns:
The last pending task.
Since:
1.0

submit

public final void submit(java.lang.Runnable r)

Submits a task to this task manager.

If the task manager is sleeping, this method wakes it up after pushing the specified task in the end of its task queue.

Since:
1.0
